what: Helper Functions for the MotrpacRatTraining6moWATData R Package
title: Helper Functions for the MotrpacRatTraining6moWATData R Package
text: collection functions analysis visualization MoTrPAC PASS1B white adipose tissue (WAT) data provided MotrpacRatTraining6moData package. package built specifically generate MotrpacRatTraining6moWATData package, much tailored use datasets, though users may find functionality contained herein useful projects: Differential analysis (DA) limma edgeR packages Fast Gene Set Enrichment Analysis (FGSEA) fgsea msigdbr Kinase-Substrate Enrichment Analysis (KSEA) PhosphoSitePlus -representation analysis (ORA) Weighted Gene Co-expression Network Analysis (WGCNA)

title: Helper Functions for the MotrpacRatTraining6moWATData R Package
text: Install package devtools:
code: if (!require("devtools", quietly = TRUE))   install.packages("devtools")  devtools::install_github("MoTrPAC/MotrpacRatTraining6moWAT")

J., Vamvini, M., Bergman, B., Fernández, F. M., Goodyear, L. J., Ortlund, E. ., … Schenk, S. (2023). Sexual dimorphism multi-omic response exercise training rat subcutaneous white adipose tissue. BioRxiv. https://doi.org/10.1101/2023.02.03.527012

title: Advanced Substrings of a Character Vector — cutstr
text: x character vector. split length 1 character vector. Used split x. n integer; maximum length output string.

title: Advanced Substrings of a Character Vector — cutstr
text: character vector length x.

title: Advanced Substrings of a Character Vector — cutstr
code: x <- "This is an example sentence" # Return x as-is cutstr(x) #> [1] "This is an example sentence"  # Same as substr cutstr(x, n = 15) #> [1] "This is an exam"  # Break between words cutstr(x, split = " ", n = 15) #> [1] "This is an"

title: Enrichment Heatmap — enrichmat
text: Creates heatmap summarizing FGSEA results.

title: Enrichment Heatmap — enrichmat
code: enrichmat(   x,   n_top = 15,   top_pathways = NULL,   rownames_column = "pathway",   NES_column = "NES",   padj_column = "padj",   padj_legend_title = padj_column,   padj_cutoff = 0.05,   plot_sig_only = TRUE,   padj_fill = "grey",   colors = c("#3366ff", "darkred"),   scale_by = c("row", "column", "none"),   cell_size = unit(14, "points"),   filename = character(0),   height = 5,   width = 5,   units = "in",   heatmap_args = list(),   padj_args = list(),   save_args = list(),   draw_args = list() )

title: Enrichment Heatmap — enrichmat
text: x object class data.frame; output fgsea fgsea2. Must contain "contrast" column. n_top integer; number pathways display. Defaults top 15 pathways significantly enriched across contrasts. top_pathways character; vector specific pathways display. NULL (default), n_top pathways displayed instead. rownames_column character; name column x containing unique identifiers used rownames heatmap. Default "pathway". NES_column similar rownames_column. name column containing normalized enrichment scores (NES) determines heatmap body colors. Values -1 +1 (noise) appear white. padj_column similar rownames_column. name column containing adjusted p-values determine area circle heatmap. padj_legend_title character; title background fill legend. Defaults padj_column. padj_cutoff numeric; cutoff terms statistically significant. plot_sig_only=TRUE, pathways least one padj_column value less threshold may appear heatmap. Default 0.05. plot_sig_only logical; whether plot n_top terms least one padj_column value less padj_cutoff. padj_fill character; background color used values padj_column less padj_cutoff. Default "lightgrey". colors character; vector length 2 specifying colors largest negative largest positive values, respectively. Defaults blue (#3366ff) red (specifically, darkred). scale_by character; whether scale circles -significant term row (scale_by="row"), column (scale_by="column"), overall (scale_by="none") maximum area. Default "row" better visualize patterns across contrasts. cell_size unit object; size heatmap cell. Default unit(14, "points"). filename character; filename used save heatmap. character(0) (default), heatmap displayed instead. height numeric; height file units. width height. units character; units define height width. Defaults "" (inches). heatmap_args list; additional arguments passed Heatmap. padj_args list; additional arguments passed Legend. Modifies adjusted p-value legend. save_args list; additional arguments passed graphics device. See png options. draw_args list; additional arguments passed draw-HeatmapList-method.

title: Enrichment Heatmap — enrichmat
text: Tyler Sagendorf

what: Fast Gene Set Enrichment Analysis — fgsea2
title: Fast Gene Set Enrichment Analysis — fgsea2
text: Custom wrapper fgsea use output msigdbr2.

title: Fast Gene Set Enrichment Analysis — fgsea2
code: fgsea2(   pathways,   stats,   gene_column = "entrez_gene",   adjust.method = "BH",   adjust.globally = TRUE,   seed = NULL,   ... )

title: Fast Gene Set Enrichment Analysis — fgsea2
text: pathways output msigdbr2. stats output rank_genes. gene_column character; name column pathways containing genes pathway. adjust.method character; p-value correction method. Can abbreviated. See p.adjust.methods. adjust.globally logical; p-values contrasts adjusted together using adjust.method? Set FALSE contrasts tested closely related. seed numeric NULL; passed set.seed. ... additional arguments passed fgseaMultilevel.

title: Fast Gene Set Enrichment Analysis — fgsea2
text: data.table results contrast. See fgsea details.

title: Fast Gene Set Enrichment Analysis — fgsea2
text: Tyler Sagendorf

title: Over-representation analysis — fora2
text: Custom wrapper fora.

title: Over-representation analysis — fora2
code: fora2(   pathways,   genes,   universe,   gene_column = "entrez_gene",   minSize = 1,   maxSize = length(universe) - 1,   adjust.method = "scale",   adjust.globally = TRUE )

title: Over-representation analysis — fora2
text: pathways output link{msigdbr2}. genes named list genes. usually clusters related genes. universe character vector background genes. Usually, unique elements genes. gene_column character; name column pathways containing elements gene set. minSize integer; minimum size gene sets allowed testing. maxSize integer; maximum size gene sets allowed testing. adjust.method character string; p-value correction method. Either "scale" (default), compute scaled p-values one p.adjust.methods. adjust.globally logical; p-values contrasts adjusted together using adjust.method? Set FALSE contrasts tested closely related.

title: Over-representation analysis — fora2
text: adjust.method = "scale", function calculate maximum overlap combination names(genes) (adjust.globally = TRUE), entries "gs_subcat" column pathways. gene set, calculate ratio size set's overlap one plus maximum overlap. addition 1 denominator penalize small maximum overlaps. log10(pval) multiplied overlap ratio back-transformed obtain p-values adjusted well describe group defined genes.

title: Over-representation analysis — fora2
text: Tyler Sagendorf

LIMMA Convenience Wrapper — limma_full
text: convenience wrapper differential analysis LIMMA. Performs moderated t-tests, F-tests, linear regression.

title: LIMMA Convenience Wrapper — limma_full
code: limma_full(   object,   model.str,   coef.str,   contrasts,   trend = TRUE,   robust = TRUE,   var.group = character(0),   block = NULL,   plot = FALSE,   adjust.method = "BH",   adjust.globally = TRUE,   ... )

title: LIMMA Convenience Wrapper — limma_full
text: object Object class ExpressionSet. exprs slot can either matrix log\(_2\) relative abundances counts. latter, limma--edgeR pipeline (https://doi.org/10.12688/f1000research.9005.3) automatically used. model.str character; formulation model (e.g. "~ + b"). contrasts provided, -intercept model (include 0 -1 terms). See lm details. coef.str character; coefficient interest. One colnames(pData(object)). contrasts character; optional contrasts form "-b" test. trend logical; intensity-dependent trend allowed prior variance? FALSE, prior variance constant. Alternatively, trend can row-wise numeric vector, used covariate prior variance. See eBayes details. robust logical; estimation df.prior var.prior robustified outlier sample variances? See eBayes details. var.group character; column pData(object) indicating groups different relative quality weights. default (character(0)) weight sample equally (samples given weight 1). Weights affect logFC P.Value columns results. block NULL character; name column pData(object) specifying blocking variable. Passed duplicateCorrelation. Section 9.7 "Multi-level Experiments" LIMMA User's Guide (see limmaUsersGuide) explains use duplicateCorrelation. Currently ignored exprs(object) matrix counts. plot logical; whether generate diagnostic plots. TRUE, generates barplot weights applied sample plot mean-variance trend using plotSA. adjust.method method p-value adjustment. Default "BH" (Benjamini-Hochberg), control false discovery rate (FDR). See p.adjust details. adjust.globally logical; p-values contrasts adjusted together using adjust.method? Set FALSE contrasts tested closely related. See Section 13.3 "Multiple Testing Across Contrasts" LIMMA User's Guide (limmaUsersGuide) information. ... additional arguments passed plotSA.

title: LIMMA Convenience Wrapper — limma_full
text: data.frame. Output topTable additional columns feature, contrast, column(s) standard error (SE) logFC. columns fData also included.

title: LIMMA Convenience Wrapper — limma_full
text: MDS plot (plotMDS) used determine appropriate value var.group. samples within phenotype groups tend cluster well similar dispersions, default var.group = character(0) recommended. samples within phenotype groups tend cluster well, different groups less dispersed, may beneficial set var.group name phenotype column. one samples tend cluster poorly samples phenotype, may beneficial weight sample. , set var.group name column pData(object) uniquely identifies sample. variation samples groups samples biological rather technical, weighting recommended. plot mean-variance trend helps determine whether fit trend line prior variance (default trend = TRUE). also helps determine prior variance robustified outlier sample variances (robust = TRUE). See eBayes details.

title: LIMMA Convenience Wrapper — limma_full
text: Smyth G. K. (2004). Linear models empirical bayes methods assessing differential expression microarray experiments. Statistical applications genetics molecular biology, 3, Article3. https://doi.org/10.2202/1544-6115.1027 Smyth, G. K., Michaud, J., Scott, H. (2005). use within-array replicate spots assessing differential expression microarray experiments. Bioinformatics 21(9), 2067--2075. http://bioinformatics.oxfordjournals.org/content/21/9/2067 Preprint corrections: http://www.statsci.org/smyth/pubs/dupcor.pdf Liu, R., Holik, . Z., Su, S., Jansz, N., Chen, K., Leong, H. S., Blewitt, M. E., Asselin-Labat, M. L., Smyth, G. K., & Ritchie, M. E. (2015). weight? Modelling sample observational level variability improves power RNA-seq analyses. Nucleic acids research, 43(15), e97. https://doi.org/10.1093/nar/gkv412 Law, C. W., Alhamdoosh, M., Su, S., Dong, X., Tian, L., Smyth, G. K., & Ritchie, M. E. (2016). RNA-seq analysis easy 1-2-3 limma, Glimma edgeR. F1000Research, 5, ISCB Comm J-1408. https://doi.org/10.12688/f1000research.9005.3 Phipson, B., Lee, S., Majewski, . J., Alexander, W. S., & Smyth, G. K. (2016). ROBUST HYPERPARAMETER ESTIMATION PROTECTS HYPERVARIABLE GENES IMPROVES POWER DETECT DIFFERENTIAL EXPRESSION. annals applied statistics, 10(2), 946--963. https://doi.org/10.1214/16-AOAS920

title: LIMMA Convenience Wrapper — limma_full
text: Tyler Sagendorf, Vlad Petyuk

what: Get gene sets / pathways from MSigDB — msigdbr2
title: Get gene sets / pathways from MSigDB — msigdbr2
text: Wrapper around msigdbr. Reformats pathway data use fgsea2.

title: Get gene sets / pathways from MSigDB — msigdbr2
code: msigdbr2(   species = "Homo sapiens",   genes = c("gene_symbol", "entrez_gene", "ensembl_gene"),   gs_subcat,   capitalize = FALSE )

title: Get gene sets / pathways from MSigDB — msigdbr2
text: species character; scientific common name species. Default "Homo sapiens". msigdbr::msigdbr_species displays possible choices. genes character; type gene ID fetch. Options "gene_symbol", "entrez_gene", "ensembl_gene". gs_subcat character vector one MSigDB subcategories. See msigdbr_collections details. capitalize logical; whether capitalize first letter description first word contain mix capital lowercase letters. Improves appearance plots, produced enrichmat.

title: Get gene sets / pathways from MSigDB — msigdbr2
text: data.table columns "gs_exact_source" (term ID), "gs_subcat" (subcategory), "gs_description" (term description), list-column gene IDs specified genes.

title: Get gene sets / pathways from MSigDB — msigdbr2
text: Liberzon, ., Birger, C., Thorvaldsdóttir, H., Ghandi, M., Mesirov, J. P., & Tamayo, P. (2015). Molecular Signatures Database (MSigDB) hallmark gene set collection. Cell systems, 1(6), 417--425. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.cels.2015.12.004 Dolgalev, . (2022). msigdbr: MSigDB Gene Sets Multiple Organisms Tidy Data Format. R package version 7.5.1, https:://igordot.github.io/msigdbr

title: Get gene sets / pathways from MSigDB — msigdbr2
code: # Reactome pathways and GO Molecular Functions: x <- msigdbr2(species = "rat",               genes = "gene_symbol",               gs_subcat = c("CP:REACTOME", "GO:MF")) #> Searching MSigDB 7.5.1 Release Notes for OBO file date: #> Error in obo_file(version = version): argument "obo_file" is missing, with no default

title: Plot module ORA results — plot_ORA

title: Plot module ORA results — plot_ORA
text: x output fora fora2. n_terms integer; maximum number top -represented terms display module. mods integer; module numbers include plot. default, terms modules 1-5 (5 largest modules) shown. subset character; gene set subcategory terms plot. Default "GO:MF". rel_heights numeric; vector length 2 specifying relative heights plot color legend, respectively. Default c(0.8, 0.2).

title: Plot module ORA results — plot_ORA

what: Calculate GSEA ranking metric values — rank_genes
title: Calculate GSEA ranking metric values — rank_genes
text: Calculate GSEA ranking metric values fgsea2.

title: Calculate GSEA ranking metric values — rank_genes
code: rank_genes(   x,   genes,   metric = "-log10(P.Value)*sign(logFC)",   contrast_column = "contrast" )

title: Calculate GSEA ranking metric values — rank_genes
text: x object class data.frame. Typically results limma_full. genes character; name column x. ranking metric value calculated unique entry. Usually gene symbols, Entrez IDs, Ensembl genes work output msigdbr2. metric character; specifies ranking metric calculated x. Can name single column. contrast_column character; name column x. Entries column set names output list.

title: Calculate GSEA ranking metric values — rank_genes
text: named vector ("contrast" column) list named vectors sorted ranking metric values contrast x.

title: Calculate GSEA ranking metric values — rank_genes
text: -log\(_{10}\)-transformed p-value signed fold-change similar t-statistic, clearly separates extreme values tails close 0 interesting.

title: Run WGCNA Pipeline — run_WGCNA
text: Run WGCNA pipeline used MoTrPAC PASS1B WAT manuscript.

title: Run WGCNA Pipeline — run_WGCNA
code: run_WGCNA(object, power = 1:20, RsquaredCut = 0.9, module_prefix = "")

title: Run WGCNA Pipeline — run_WGCNA
text: object object class ExpressionSet. exprs matrix log\(_2\)-transformed values. Count data accepted. power integer; optional soft power vector (length 1 greater). specified, lowest value 1--20 satisfies scale-free fit R\(^2 \geq\) RsquaredCut used. RsquaredCut numeric; minimum acceptable scale-free fit R\(^2\). Ignored power provided. module_prefix character; appended module numbers create "moduleID" column.

title: Run WGCNA Pipeline — run_WGCNA
text: Object class list length 2: "modules": data.frame following columns, addition columns Biobase::fData(object). moduleColor moduleColor; unique color assigned module. "grey" module always contains features co-expressed. moduleID factor; module_prefix followed unique module number. "grey" module always 0. "MEs": data.frame 3 variables, addition variables pData(object). moduleID factor; module_prefix followed unique module number. "grey" module always 0. numeric; module eigenfeature values. One per sample x module combination. moduleNum integer; unique module ID number. "grey" module always 0.

title: Run WGCNA Pipeline — run_WGCNA
text: Zhang, B., & Horvath, S. (2005). general framework weighted gene co-expression network analysis. Statistical applications genetics molecular biology, 4, Article17. https://doi.org/10.2202/1544-6115.1128 Langfelder P Horvath S, WGCNA: R package weighted correlation network analysis. BMC Bioinformatics 2008, 9:559 https://doi.org/10.1186/1471-2105-9-559 Peter Langfelder, Steve Horvath (2012). Fast R Functions Robust Correlations Hierarchical Clustering. Journal Statistical Software, 46(11), 1--17. http://www.jstatsoft.org/v46/i11/ Horvath, S. (2011). Weighted Network Analysis. Springer New York. https://doi.org/10.1007/978-1-4419-8819-5 Langfelder P, Zhang B, Horvath wcfS (2016). dynamicTreeCut: Methods Detection Clusters Hierarchical Clustering Dendrograms. R package version 1.63-1, https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=dynamicTreeCut.

title: Run WGCNA Pipeline — run_WGCNA
text: Zhenxin Hou, Tyler Sagendorf

what: Update Gene Ontology term descriptions — update_GO_names
title: Update Gene Ontology term descriptions — update_GO_names
text: Update entries gs_description column msigdbr results use terms Gene Ontology Consortium.

title: Update Gene Ontology term descriptions — update_GO_names
code: update_GO_names(   x,   version = packageVersion("msigdbr"),   capitalize = FALSE,   obo_file )

title: Update Gene Ontology term descriptions — update_GO_names
text: x object class data.frame produced link[msigdbr]{msigdbr} msigdbr2 containing columns gs_description gs_subcat. version character; specifies version msigdbr use. Defaults current version. capitalize logical; whether capitalize first letter description first word contain mix capital lowercase letters. Improves appearance plots, produced enrichmat. obo_file character; optional path OBO file used update Gene Ontology term descriptions. provide appropriate OBO file extracted MSigDB Release Notes (See Details).

title: Update Gene Ontology term descriptions — update_GO_names
text: Object class data.frame. x, updated descriptions.

title: Update Gene Ontology term descriptions — update_GO_names
text: function assumes phrase "GO-basic obo file released " present MSigDB release notes version followed date. date replace "RELEASE_DATE" "http://release.geneontology.org/RELEASE_DATE/ontology/go-basic.obo".

title: Update Gene Ontology term descriptions — update_GO_names
text: Ashburner, M., et al. (2000). Gene ontology: tool unification biology. Gene Ontology Consortium. Nature genetics, 25(1), 25--29. https://doi.org/10.1038/75556 Gene Ontology Consortium (2021). Gene Ontology resource: enriching GOld mine. Nucleic acids research, 49(D1), D325--D334. https://doi.org/10.1093/nar/gkaa1113

title: Update Gene Ontology term descriptions — update_GO_names
text: Tyler Sagendorf

title: Update Gene Ontology term descriptions — update_GO_names
code: x <- msigdbr2(species = "Homo sapiens",               genes = "gene_symbol",               gs_subcat = "GO:MF") #> Searching MSigDB 7.5.1 Release Notes for OBO file date: #> Error in obo_file(version = version): argument "obo_file" is missing, with no default set.seed(9900) idx <- sample(1:nrow(x), size = 6) # random indices to illustrate changes #> Error in h(simpleError(msg, call)): error in evaluating the argument 'x' in selecting a method for function 'nrow': object 'x' not found x$gs_description[idx] # before #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'x' not found  y <- update_GO_names(x, capitalize = TRUE) #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'x' not found y$gs_description[idx] # after #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'y' not found

title: MotrpacRatTraining6moWAT 1.0.0
text: Added ggplotMDS, plot_baseline, plot_eigenfeature, plot_pre_post, plot_volcano, theme_pub, plot_ORA, cutstr functions. used MotrpacRatTraining6moWATData articles. Add PDF support enrichmat.
